author: Hank Sanders
title: South Holland hosts Cook County sheriff’s free car light replacement for grateful residents
text:
Broken headlights and turn signal lights are common causes for drivers to be pulled over by police. Dozens of residents were able to avoid the possibility of such a ticket Thursday, and improve the safety of their cars, when the Cook County sheriff’s office provided free light replacement at the South Holland Police Department.
“We will purchase the tail light for your car based on the make and model,” said Marlon Parks, Cook County undersheriff. “And then we will give you a date where we will be in your community and we will fix it for free.”
Auto body shops will often charge more than $100 to replace car lights; one resident told Parks he was quoted $600 for a light change. But with the county purchasing lights wholesale at $15 to $30 a bulb and using its own staff mechanics, residents can save big without it being a large expense for the county budget, officials said.
Since August 2021, the county has rotated throughout different police stations in the county. Residents are allowed to sign up ahead of time by informing the sheriff’s office of their car’s make and model and which lights are out. Then they drive to their local police station, pop their hoods and wait between five and 20 minutes while county mechanics do the work.
County officials did not know how much Thursday’s free light installation, known as the Light Saver Event, would cost. Even though more than 20 of these events have been held, including three so far in 2024, things such as the price of the lights, the number of sign ups and even the weather affect the cost.
But the overall minimal cost of changing the lights on 30 to 80 cars is a good investment for several reasons, explained county officials.
“In the end, you’re saving so much. You’re gaining public trust,” said Tisa Morris, executive director of community engagement for the sheriff’s office. “People see a different side of what the police are traditionally viewed as. So that has value in and of itself.”
Thursday, the first time this initiative has come to South Holland, saw 62 signups. But officials say they also take walk-ups if a resident’s car model matches the extra lights they have around.
A line of four cars idled outside the South Holland police station at 10 a.m. Luis Covarrubias, a vehicle serviceman for the sheriff’s office, stuck his hand down a small hole in the hood of a Hyundai, feeling for the driver’s side headlight. He reached for a flashlight to get a better view.
Covarrubias twisted out of its socket a 2-inch glass cone and inspected the blown fuse. Into the trash.
He went to the table that had a spread of bulbs, came back with the replacement and installed the new light speedily, learning from his struggles during the removal process.
“Every car varies in skill. Some are more difficult than others — just the location of the lights and connectors,” said Covarrubias. European cars, specifically German-made, are the most challenging.
This is the first time Glenwood resident Pamela Walker, 62, has been to a Light Saver Event. She was blown away by the service.
“It’s really cool,” said Walker, who needed new signal, tail and license plate lights.
She hasn’t been pulled over for her light issues, but now she probably won’t have to be concerned for years about being stopped for her lights. Cars.com says lights dim over time but may work for five to six years.
Plus, Walker doesn’t like going to the mechanic.
“As women, we get taken advantage of when you go to dealership places to get it done,” she said. “They say you need this, that and another and you really don’t.”
The next vehicle lighting event is on May 9 in Phoenix. Interested residents may register via the sheriff’s office website at www.cookcountysheriffil.gov/events/
hsanders@chicagotribune.com

author: @KCRG
title: Advocates share concerns with changes coming to Iowa’s mental health system
text:
DES MOINES, Iowa (Gray Media Iowa Capitol Bureau) - An overhaul of the state’s mental health and substance abuse system is slated to happen next summer.
Earlier this year, Iowa Governor Kim Reynolds signed a bill that would merge the state’s 32 separate mental health and substance abuse regions into seven behavioral health districts.
Leslie Carpenter with Iowa Mental Health Advocacy was excited for the change.
“The proposal, as I understood it at the time, was that there would be seven behavioral health districts that would provide the administration of both mental illness treatment and substance use treatment in these seven districts with input from people locally within those districts,” she said.
That’s not what the state ended up doing. Last week, the state announced it chose a single provider - the Iowa Primary Care Association - to run all seven. And that has Carpenter concerned.
“If somebody calls from Northwest Iowa, whoever’s answering that phone in Des Moines may not be aware of all of the people and resources that are available in Northwest Iowa,” she said.
On a listening session hosted by Iowa HHS Thursday, Sarah Dixon with the Iowa Primary Care Association says managing all seven districts will allow for a singular, centralized administration with staff in each district.
“These individuals will be tasked with the unique needs of their district, ensuring we’re bringing the right people to the table to complete meaningful district assessment and planning efforts, systems navigation, and community engagement and education,” she said.
Dixon says the ICPA is working to make sure the transition runs smoothly.
“We are committed to ensuring this transition does not disrupt the care Iowans are receiving today and that our local providers receive the support they need to be successful,” she said.
Carpenter says she’s worried the state may lose some of its behavioral health staff in the transition. “Even though it hasn’t always run perfectly, the individuals within it are amazing,” she said.
Iowa HHS says it is finalizing the statewide behavioral health system plan. It will allow the public to weigh in on the changes in January before they take effect.
--
Conner Hendricks covers state government and politics for Gray Media-owned stations in Iowa. Email him at conner.hendricks@gray.tv ; and follow him on Facebook at Conner Hendricks TV or on X/Twitter @ConnerReports .

author: Tara Brolley
title: Dozens of Central Texas restaurants, bars and busi
text:
Dozens of Central Texas restaurants, bars and businesses are donating profits to flood relief efforts following devastating floods that hit Kerr County and surrounding areas over the weekend. (Scroll down to see full list of participating businesses)
At least 10 businesses are participating in coordinated fundraising efforts Thursday, with many more extending donations through the weekend and beyond.
Kerbey Lane All Day Cafe announced it will donate 100% of profits from all 10 locations Thursday to the Kerr County Flood Relief Fund.
"As parents and lifelong members of the Central Texas community, our hearts go out to everyone impacted by the recent floods in Texas," said Christina and Mason Ayer, owners of Kerbey Lane All Day Cafe. "At Kerbey Lane, giving back is at the core of who we are, and donating 100% of profits from all 10 Kerbey Lane locations to the Kerr County Flood Relief Fund is one way we can swiftly act and stand with our neighbors during this devastating time."
P. Terry's Burger Stand is also donating 100% of profits from all 36 locations Thursday, with funds going to the Austin Disaster Relief Network's "Central Texas Flood" campaign.
Other businesses participating in Thursday's coordinated effort include Veracruz All Natural, which will donate 100% of profits from seven locations to the American Red Cross Hill Country Chapter; Kesos Tacos, donating profits to the Kerr County Flood Relief Fund; and Moonshine Patio Bar & Grill, also supporting the Kerr County fund.
Hattie B's Hot Chicken announced 100% of sales from Austin and Dallas stores Thursday will benefit the Central Texas Food Bank's flood victim assistance efforts.
Several businesses have extended their fundraising efforts beyond Thursday. Good Vibration Pizza began donating 100% of profits Wednesday and plans to continue the effort. Mernin' Coffee is donating all profits through July 14.
LiftATX fitness studio is donating a portion of day passes through Sunday to the Kerr County Relief Fund.
Weekend efforts include Tyler's Westlake location donating 100% of profits Friday, and Tumble 22 donating all profits from multiple locations Friday. Central Texas Machine Works will donate $1 from every pretzel, frozen cocktail and American Lager sold Saturday and Sunday.
Milam & Greene Whiskey announced it will donate 15% of all online and distillery sales through July 15 to the Community Foundation of Texas Hill Country, with additional donations from special releases.
The complete list of participating businesses and their specific donation details: Thursday, July 10:
Friday, July 11:
Saturday-Sunday, July 12-13:
Extended efforts through July:

author: Suhely Bueno
title: "Não aceito que Trump venha meter bedelho", diz Mourão sobre o Brasil
text:
Vice-presidente na gestão de Jair Bolsonaro, o senador disse que ‘injustiças” contra o ex-presidente devem ser debatidas internamente O senador Hamilton Mourão (Republicanos-RS), que foi vice-presidente na gestão de Jair Bolsonaro (PL), disse nesta terça-feira (15/7) que “não aceita” que o presidente dos Estados Unidos, Donald Trump, “venha meter o bedelho” em questões internas do Brasil.
A declaração se deu durante audiência da Comissão de Relações Exteriores (CRE) do Senado que discute a tarifa de 50% anunciada pelo governo norte-americano contra os produtos brasileiros.
“Da mesma forma, caros colegas, que não aceito que o Macron, que a Greta Thunberg, que o Leonardo DiCaprio, venham meter a mão em coisas aqui do Brasil, eu também, e aí o senador Humberto Costa (PT-PE), somos oposição um ao outro, mas eu não aceito que o Trump venha meter o bedelho num caso aqui que é interno nosso”, declarou o ex-vice-presidente. Veja:
Mourão disse que existe uma “injustiça” no processo contra Bolsonaro pela trama golpista, mas declarou que isso é uma questão que deve ser resolvida pelos brasileiros, e não por estrangeiros.
“Há uma injustiça sendo praticada contra o presidente Bolsonaro? Há uma injustiça sendo praticada. Mas compete a nós, brasileiros, resolvermos isso”, argumentou o senador.
A CRE do Senado debate desde desta terça a estratégia do Brasil diante da recente tarifa anunciada
Além de senadores, participam da audiência:
embaixador Philip Fox, secretário de Assuntos Econômicos e Financeiros do Itamaraty; Luis Rua, secretário de Comércio e Relações Internacionais do Ministério da Agricultura; Jefferson de Oliveira Gomes, Diretor de Desenvolvimento Industrial, Tecnologia e Inovação na Confederação da Indústria (CNI); e Michel Platini Juliani, presidente da Associação Brasileira dos Importadores (Abimp) Crédito Metrópoles

author: 电玩墨客 探索3D视觉游戏的魅力！本文将带你走进热门的3D世界，领略那些令人沉浸的游戏佳作。无论是极致画质的冒险、策略深度的竞技，还是创新玩法的解谜之作，这里有你不可错过的精选列表。快来一探究竟，体验超越二维的乐趣吧！ 1 不义联盟 不义联盟：我们之中的神游戏故事有漫画前传。漫画里超人建立全球独裁政府，源于小丑骗超人误杀怀孕的路易丝·雷恩并毁大都会后超人想独自获世界和平。玩家可化身DC经典角色进行跨时空大乱斗，游戏集结众多耳熟能详的DC漫画英雄，已公布的有蝙蝠侠、超人、猫女、神奇女侠、闪电侠、电子人、夜翼、小丑女、所罗门.格兰迪等九名角色。 不义联盟 Injustice：Gods Among Us 2013-11-30发行 格斗游戏/动作/单人/合作/多人/剧情丰富/氛围/漫画/本地多人/好评原声音轨/2.5D/2D/控制器/格斗/竞技/街机/格斗游戏/好评原声音乐/带状卷轴动作/2D 格斗/清版动作/3D 视觉/二维/单机多人/伪 3D/超級英雄/二維/大师级/假3D/伪3D/3D视觉/漫画英雄/蝙蝠侠 PC/PS3/PS4/WiiU/Xbox360 查看详情
title: 3D视觉游戏哪些好玩 热门3D视觉游戏精选_游戏单机游戏-中关村在线
text: 探索3D视觉游戏的魅力！本文将带你走进热门的3D世界，领略那些令人沉浸的游戏佳作。无论是极致画质的冒险、策略深度的竞技，还是创新玩法的解谜之作，这里有你不可错过的精选列表。快来一探究竟，体验超越二维的乐趣吧！ 1 不义联盟 不义联盟：我们之中的神游戏故事有漫画前传。漫画里超人建立全球独裁政府，源于小丑骗超人误杀怀孕的路易丝·雷恩并毁大都会后超人想独自获世界和平。玩家可化身DC经典角色进行跨时空大乱斗，游戏集结众多耳熟能详的DC漫画英雄，已公布的有蝙蝠侠、超人、猫女、神奇女侠、闪电侠、电子人、夜翼、小丑女、所罗门.格兰迪等九名角色。 2 我的自由农场2 我的自由农场2是upjers制作的模拟游戏。游戏中玩家可体验模拟农场经营，包括种植作物、养殖动物等基础农事操作。玩家能根据自己的规划开垦土地、选择合适的作物播种并精心照料直至收获。在养殖方面，可挑选不同种类的动物饲养。通过这些活动，玩家要合理安排资源、管理农场，努力将农场发展壮大，体验农场主的生活，感受模拟经营带来的乐趣。 3 潘多拉的末路 穷途末路为快节奏魔幻策略经营游戏。游戏场景是随机生成的深渊一隅，玩家要消耗理智获取非自身力量。游戏设定在无尽之海，玩家的任务是创造新天堂以迎回旧日神的遗民。 4 航母指挥官：盖亚的使命 航母指挥官：盖亚的使命由捷克开发商Bohemia Interactive打造。该游戏有独特新颖之处，它将第一人称与第三人称动作相结合，形成一种新的游戏方式，并且融入即时策略游戏元素。游戏场景设定于大规模的群岛之上，这些群岛为游戏中的各种动作、策略运用等提供了背景环境，多种元素的融合为玩家带来独特的游戏体验。 5 模拟航空飞行2 模拟航空飞行2是IPACS制作发行的次世代飞行模拟游戏。它有直观用户界面，便于玩家轻松学习飞行基本知识。游戏能让玩家进入高品质飞行世界，可在驾驶舱俯瞰金门大桥、恶魔岛等景观，还能坐在机长座位，操控飞机在最繁忙的机场降落雄伟的747，为玩家带来真实且丰富的飞行模拟体验。 6 Dustoff Z Dustoff Z是一款僵尸题材生存飞行射击游戏。玩家可招募队友乘直升机执行多种任务，像营救、护航、摧毁战略目标等。游戏中玩家要在恶劣条件与天气下，运用武装直升 机战 斗策略作战，拿起武器弹药应对随时爆发的大战。 7 F1赛车明星 F1赛车明星是Codemasters Racing开发的竞速游戏。游戏Q味十足，玩家可在充满可爱风格的世界中，操控著名赛车手进行飙车。该开发商已取消其他游戏类型，专注于赛车游戏开发，这或许也预示着F1赛车明星在赛车游戏领域将不断发展，为玩家带来更多以著名赛车手为主角的可爱风格竞速体验。 8 画家之战 画家之战是Dio Alias Games制作的休闲游戏。其功能特色为支持玩家在线比赛，比赛每轮有一个主题，玩家在绘画过程中可运用铅笔、橡皮擦、喷雾等工具进行创作，创作完成后通过投票选出最佳作品。 9 FaceRig FaceRig由Holotech Studios开发，是一款虚拟角色模拟 软件 。它并非传统电子游戏，但独特互动性使其收获众多玩家喜爱与支持。 10 河洛群侠传 河洛群侠传为河洛工作室制作、方块游戏发行的角色扮演游戏。其继承该工作室高自由度特色，角色养成系统玩法丰富，玩家可在众多队友陪伴下构建独特武林世界。 以上是关于热门3D视觉游戏精选的详细阐述，每一款作品都独具特色和游戏体验。我们深信，您定能在其中觅得钟爱的一款。对于任何一款引起您兴趣的游戏，只需点击即可进一步探索或 下载 亲身体验。 本文属于原创文章，如若转载，请注明来源： 3D视觉游戏哪些好玩 热门3D视觉游戏精选 https://game.zol.com.cn/966/9667860.html

author: Open
title: Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham
text:
Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham is a multi-disciplinary, world-class university in India, founded by Sri Mata Amritanandamayi Devi (Amma). With its headquarters at Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, the university has campuses across the country, including Coimbatore, Bengaluru, Amritapuri, Amaravati Chennai, Kochi, Mysuru, Nagercoil and Faridabad. Known for its commitment to academic excellence and social responsibility, Amrita offers a wide range of programs across engineering, medicine, Ayurveda, business, Biotechnology, agriculture, architecture, nanotechnology, arts, humanities, mass communication, social sciences, and emerging technologies.
Ranked 7th in the University category by NIRF 2024 Amrita is distinguished for its research output, industry collaborations, and global outlook. It emphasizes sustainable development, compassionate values, and research-driven education that addresses real-world challenges. With partnerships with over 200 universities worldwide, Amrita facilitates global learning opportunities, student exchange programs, and collaborative research.
The institution’s ethos of integrating scientific knowledge with spiritual wisdom makes it a unique hub for holistic education. Its focus on innovative research in fields like healthcare, AI, data science, and environmental sciences aligns with its vision of contributing to the well-being of society.
Amrita’s commitment to humanitarian service, inspired by Amma’s teachings, ensures that students graduate not just as professionals but also as responsible citizens with a mindset to serve society.
(A marketing initiative by Open Avenues)

persons.name: Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham
